arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.name: Conference on Disarmament
arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.purpose: To negotiate arms control and disarmament agreements.

arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.name: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
members: All member states of the United Nations except for Egypt, Israel, North Korea, and South Sudan
arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.purpose: To implement the provisions of the Chemical Weapons Convention to achieve a world free of chemical weapons.

arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.name: Preparatory Commission for the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization
arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.purpose: To build up the verification regime of the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty in preparation for its entry into force.

arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.name: Wassenaar Arrangement
arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.purpose: To contribute to regional and international security and stability by promoting transparency in the transfer of arms and dual-use goods and technologies.

arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.name: Nuclear Suppliers Group
arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.purpose: To prevent nuclear proliferation by controlling the export of materials, equipment, and technology that can be used to manufacture nuclear weapons.

arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.name: Australia Group
arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.purpose: To help member countries identify those exports which need to be controlled so as not to contribute to the spread of chemical and biological weapons.

arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.name: Missile Technology Control Regime
arms_control_organizations_and_treaties.purpose: To restrict the proliferation of missiles, rocket systems, unmanned air vehicles, and related technology for systems capable of carrying a 500 kg payload at least 300 km.
